intro: Chasmone apiculata, commonly known as the narrowleaf chasmone, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
